title: Gulf African Bank
text:
Gulf African Bank (GAB), whose full name is Gulf African Bank Limited, is a <a href="commercial%20bank">commercial bank</a> in Kenya operating under an <a href="Islamic%20banking">Islamic banking</a> regime. It is licensed by the <a href="Central%20Bank%20of%20Kenya">Central Bank of Kenya</a>, the <a href="central%20bank">central bank</a> and national banking regulator.
 the bank was a mid-sized financial services provider in <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>. Its total assets were valued at approximately US$191.8 million (KES:19, 753, 647 billion), with customer deposits totalling approximately US$153.3 million (KES:15.8 billion), and shareholders' equity estimated at approximately US$30.6 million (KES:3.15 billion). At that time, the bank was ranked number 25, by assets, out of the 43 licensed banks in Kenya then. The bank has plans to enter <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a> and <a href="Tanzania">Tanzania</a>.
History.
Discussions to establish the bank started in 2005, by individuals and institutions from the <a href="Persian%20Gulf">Persian Gulf</a> and <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a>. The bank began banking operations in 2008, after receiving a commercial banking license and authorisation to establish a <a href="Islamic%20banking">Sharia bank</a>, from the <a href="Central%20Bank%20of%20Kenya">Central Bank of Kenya</a>. Gulf African Bank is the second commercial bank in Kenya to receive authorisation to practice <a href="Sharia%20banking">Sharia banking</a>, after <a href="First%20Community%20Bank">First Community Bank</a>, which opened in 2007. At the time it opened, Gulf African Bank's capital base totalled over US$21 million (KES:1.75 billion).
Ownership.
The shares of <a href="stock">stock</a> in Gulf African Bank are privately held by institutional and private investors from the <a href="Persian%20Gulf">Persian Gulf</a>, <a href="Kenya">Kenya</a> and the United States of America. Institutional investors account for over 90% shareholding. The major shareholders in the bank include the investors listed in the table below. In September 2012, the <a href="International%20Finance%20Corporation">International Finance Corporation</a> acquired 16% shareholding in the bank for US$5 million. It is not clear how the shareholding will look after the money changes hands.
